alert.note: Alert for Boone; Kanawha; Lincoln (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 16 at 8:11PM EST until February 18 at 3:24AM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Charleston WV has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in West Virginia... Coal River At Tornado affecting Lincoln, Boone and Kanawha Counties. For the Coal River...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING TO EARLY SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Coal River At Tornado. * WHEN...From Friday morning to early Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 27.0 feet, Coal River Road is flooded in several places along river. Smith Creek Road and Ferrell Road are impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 PM EST Thursday the stage was 13.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow morning to a crest of 26.6 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 25.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 26.4 feet on 04/04/2015. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rlx. The next statement will be issued Friday morning at 815 AM EST.
